intro: Gomphrena polygonoides, commonly known as the Indian spunflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, spiky inflorescences that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in compact heads. Gomphrena polygonoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
